added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import re from webob import exc from muranoapi.db.catalog import categories as ctg from muranoapi.db.catalog import packages as pkg from muranoapi.openstack.common import exception from muranoapi.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # noqa from muranoapi.openstack.common import log as logging from muranoapi.openstack.common import wsgi LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) MUTABLE_PARAMS = ('tags', 'name', 'description') SUPPORTED_FILTERS = ('order_by', 'category', 'page_number', 'page_size', 'type', 'class', 'category', 'owned') SUPPORTED_TYPES = ('class', 'library') def validate(body): fqn = body.get('fully_qualified_name') if not re.match(r'^\w+(\.\w+)*\w+$', fqn): msg = _('fully_qualified_name is required and should qualify FQDN ' 'spelling - locations should be separated by a dot') LOG.debug(msg) raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) pkg_type = body.get('type') if pkg_type and pkg_type.lower() not in SUPPORTED_TYPES: msg = _('Package type is not supported. Specify on of the ' 'following types: ' + ', '.join(SUPPORTED_TYPES)) LOG.debug(msg) raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) category = body.get('category') supported_ctgs = ctg.Categories.get_available() if category not in supported_ctgs: msg = _("Category {0} doesn't exist. Please specify one of the " "following: ".format(category) + ", ".join(supported_ctgs)) raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) class Controller(object): """ WSGI controller for application catalog resource in Murano v1 API The images resource API is a RESTful web service for image data. The API is as follows:: GET /catalog/packages({?page_number?page_size?order_by?type?category? -- allows to list packages and search though catalog POST /catalog/packages -- allows to upload new application packages GET /catalog/packages/{id} -- retrieve a Package PATCH /catalog/packages/{id} -- allows to edit mutable fields (tags, name, description) GET catalog/packages/{id}/download -- get package with application definition GET /catalog/packages/{id}/ui -- retrieve UI definition f GET /catalog/packages/{id}/logo -- Retrieve application logo which described in a package with provided id GET /catalog/packages/categories -- retrieve list of all available application categories """ def _check_for_mutable(self, params): for item in params: if item not in MUTABLE_PARAMS: raise Exception def _get_search_filters(self, req): filters = {} for param in req.params: if param in MUTABLE_PARAMS: filters[param] = req.params.get(param) else: #TODO(efedorova): raise an exception here pass return filters # /catalog/packages({?page_number?page_size?order_by?type?category}) def search(self, req): """ List all packages or search by supported parameters """ #TODO(efedorova): Add pagination filters = self._get_search_filters(req) packages = pkg.Packages.search(filters) return packages def upload(self, req, body=None): """ Upload new file archive for the new package together with new metadata about that package """ try: req.get_content_type(('application/json',)) except exception.InvalidContentType: msg = _("Content-Type must be application/json") LOG.debug(msg) raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) variables = validate(body) LOG.debug("Catalog:Packages:Update <Body: {0}>".format(body)) package_meta = pkg.Packages.upload(variables) return package_meta def update(self, req, package_id, variables): self._check_for_mutable(variables.keys()) package_meta = pkg.Packages.update(variables) return package_meta def get(self, req, package_id): #TODO(efedorova): check package_id exists package_meta = pkg.Packages.get(package_id) return package_meta def delete(self, req, package_id): #TODO(efedorova): check package_id exists pkg.Packages.delete(package_id) def get_ui(self, req, package_id): #TODO(efedorova): check package_id exists ui_definition = pkg.Packages.get_ui_definition(package_id) return {'ui_definition': ui_definition} def get_logo(self, req, package_id): #TODO(efedorova): check package_id exists logo = pkg.Packages.get_logo(package_id) #TODO(efedorova): set valid content-type return logo def download(self, req, package_id): #TODO(efedorova): check package_id exists archive = pkg.Packages.get_archive(package_id) #TODO(efedorova): set valid content-type return archive def show_categories(self, req): categories = pkg.Packages.list_categories() return categories def create_resource(): return wsgi.Resource(Controller())

commit_message:
Python 3: cast map() result to list

On Python 3, map() returns a generator, not a list. Cast explicitly the result
of map() to a list to get a list on Python 2 and Python 3.

The cast is useless in Python 2, but it doesn't hurt performances: it's just a
unit test.

Change-Id: I87486b7dbc42507a6fd7886748a2e09735b6fc5b

commit_message:
Fix race in worker-based executor result processing

When worker-based engine receives event it should first remove
request from cache and then call request.set_result. Otherwise,
another thread waiting the request to complete might schedule
another request with same uuid (e.g. reversion of failed task),
which will replace current request in cache and then will
be deleted, thus leading to engine hang.

Related-bug: #1297668
Change-Id: Icbbca58067ee22fe45c63e1f69d189ea56697d20

commit_message:
Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()

dict.iteritems() has been removed in Python 3. In Python 2, dict.items()
creates a temporary list, but Samuel Merritt wrote:

"The size of the data is small enough that we don't need to worry about the
memory consumption; it's all just HTTP headers."

Change-Id: Iac427b8bbd032e4a1efb2bdc84a3968217eb6ddf

commit_message:
Fix bug ext2: parent directory not found with guestfs

When trying to work with guestfs an error:
  ext2: parent directory not found: /lib: File not found by ext2_lookup
To avoiding this error, after installing guestfs we have to use
the command 'sudo update-guestfs-appliance'

Change-Id: I3b0c702366739642ed61ac7ebc30a0911744a864
Closes-Bug: #1290798

commit_message:
Make index.rst usable

* Update to reflect new directory structure
* Drop maxdepth to 1, to make the page smaller, otherwise the index will
  include links to each section of each blueprint. And since each
  section will have the same name across bluepints this is useless.

Change-Id: I2a5d94ae26002a884033d27881394a795592fe3f

commit_message:
Activate hacking rule to force using module timeutils

This commit activates the rule N310 that forces to use
the timeutils.utcnow() method.

Change-Id: Id81e3ae9c0613385cde0f97663183d2fc6844ace
Related-Bug: #1297947
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/28/83328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [N310] timeutils.utcnow() wrapper must be used instead of direct calls to datetime.datetime.utcnow() to make it easy to override its return value in tests

commit_message:
VMware: Resize operation fails to change disk size

The finish_migration step will resize the cpu and memory to match
the new flavor chosen, but not the disk size.  Additional code was
added to extend the disk size using ExtendVirtualDisk_Task.

Change-Id: Iad9d023a67864cb720ddc84d7e155b991cbc7a19
Closes-bug: #1291741

commit_message:
Verify hypervisor uptime attributes of Nova API

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response of Nova V2 & V3
hypervisor uptime APIs ('os-hypervisors/<hyper_id>/uptime')
and validate the response with added JSON Schema to block
the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 hypervisor uptime APIs is same
& given below:

{
    "hypervisor": {
        "id": %(hypervisor_id)s,
        "hypervisor_hostname": "fake-mini",
        "uptime": " 08:32:11 up 93 days, 18:25, 12 users,
                  load average: 0.20, 0.12, 0.14"
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I163c50e0ad277ef8ed639363d5e53f66e9f9d4e4

commit_message:
Update Keystone sample config file

pep8 in Jenkins fails becase it's building with Keystone
client 0.7.0, but the sample config file was generated with
0.6.0. The failure is caused by changes in some descriptions
of configuration items.

Closes-Bug: #1297977
Change-Id: Iad39d1b77274ddf40b55f167bc76d5d24b5c9cd8

subject: Ensure the swift ring is readable by swift.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-28 02:33:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/990dacabead63730162de8efeec4898e02b0f447', 'message': 'Ensure the swift ring is readable by swift.

Swift recently changed its ring writing logic such that the file mode

commit_message:
Ensure the swift ring is readable by swift.

Swift recently changed its ring writing logic such that the file mode
is user-only, breaking the previous a+r mode.

Change-Id: Ie0ef451f4bb19a7546039f1fae8bbd800e85087d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/45/83645/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: chown root:swift /etc/swift/object.ring.gz chmod u+r /etc/swift/object.ring.gz

commit_message:
Fix validation error for invalid field name in simple query

The field name validation code runs only in case of the operator that is
specified for the invalid field name, is 'eq'. Otherwise the validation
ends with an invalid operator error. The field name validation code was
modified to check the field name first and only checks the operators for
valid field names.

Closes-bug: #1294628

Change-Id: Id34ae882940b36dec3ea81043b0d29b996a38426
(cherry picked from commit 50cffbc08f24ff8e3935aabecdf4be0fb366116d)

commit_message:
Verify the response status of create delete Image

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response status of Nova V2 Image
create, delete delete meta APIs and validate the response status with
added JSON Schema to block the backward incompatibility change in the
future.

create image, delete image & delete image meta does not return the
response body. Response status of above APIs is below-
create image - 202
delete image - 204
delete image meta - 204

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ia4864b3b7145a69dc257aba7f7612745b1b8254f

commit_message:
Adding section for security impact

The best way to improve security throughout OpenStack is to be more aware
of the security impact that design decisions have.  I think that adding a
section that focuses on security will help encourage people to think of this
during the design process.

This idea originated in an email thread on the openstack-security mailing
list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-security/2014-March/001351.html

Change-Id: I7945f7c99387aedabbce057130f3589831f77f1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/67/83467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Security Impact --------------- Describe any potential security impact on the system. Some of the items to consider include: * Does this change touch sensitive data such as tokens, keys, or user data? * Does this change alter the API? * Does this change involve cryptography or hashing? * Does this change require the use of sudo or any elevated privileges? * Does this change involve using or parsing user-provided data? * Can this change enable a resource exhaustion attack? For more detailed guidance, please see the OpenStack Security Guidelines as a reference (https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Security/Guidelines). These guidelines are a work in progress and are designed to help you identify security best practices. For further information, feel free to reach out to the OpenStack Security Group at openstack-security@lists.openstack.org.

commit_message:
Update template to add references

Added a new section for reference, such as ML threads, or links
to design summit notes.

At the same time, ensuring authors take care that the document
is readable without access to any of the references.

Based on an idea suggested here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/81932

Change-Id: Ifcc69ffb4e9859ad3138b7e2acc716b97d232f39

commit_message:
Adds more API error return code requirements

Adds information about the reason that error codes
can be returned by a method. This will help ensure that
people consider more of the semantics (especially the error paths)
of new API methods.

Change-Id: Ia2ff1fd2e689f5c0fad0a84e807de07d150ae9ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/21/83621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * A description for each possible error code should be included describing semantic errors which can cause it such as inconsistent parameters supplied to the method, or when an instance is not in an appropriate state for the request to succeed. Errors caused by syntactic problems covered by the JSON schema defintion do not need to be included.

commit_message:
Automatically create groups that do not exist

If the scheduler hint 'group' is specified and the contents are not a
UUID, automatically create the group.  This is to maintain backwards
compatibility with the old behavior of the 'group' scheduler hint.

The policy on this automatically created group is set as 'legacy'.
That way the scheduler knows that for this group it should emulate the
old group behavior for backwards compat purposes.

Partial-bug: #1296913

Change-Id: I0d4315980af7e47ae97dd4277784a74f086c8825

commit_message:
Add test to rescope token using v3

This adds a test that shows that an unscoped token can be used to
get a scoped token using the identity v3 API.

Change-Id: Ic0807dc8c91b0125bc9c447314cc095b511853ae

added_lines: :param domain: the user and tenant domain - domain scope is not supported here return self.auth2(user=user, password=password, tenant=tenant, user_type=user_type, domain=domain) def auth2(self, user=None, password=None, token=None, tenant=None, user_type='id', domain=None): """ :param user: user id or name, as specified in user_type :param domain: the user and tenant domain :param token: a token to re-scope. Accepts different combinations of credentials. Restrictions: - tenant and domain are only name (no id) - user domain and tenant domain are assumed identical - domain scope is not supported here Sample sample valid combinations: - token - token, tenant, domain - user_id, password - username, password, domain - username, password, tenant, domain Validation is left to the server side. """ if token: method = common.Element('method') method.append(common.Text('token')) methods.append(method) token = common.Element('token', id=token) identity.append(token) if user and password: if user_type == 'id': _user = common.Element('user', id=user, password=password) else: _user = common.Element('user', name=user, password=password) if domain is not None: _domain = common.Element('domain', name=domain) _user.append(_domain) password = common.Element('password') password.append(_user) method = common.Element('method') method.append(common.Text('password')) methods.append(method) identity.append(password) _domain = common.Element('domain', name=domain)

commit_message:
Add InstanceGroup.get_by_name()

Legacy behavior of the 'group' scheduler hint was that the value was
treated as a name for the group.  To preserve the old behavior, the
InstanceGroup object needs to be able to look up a group by name.

Since we're so close to doing an RC, just use the db API methods
available now but leave a note that this should be optimized later
with a db.api query that looks up the group by name.

Change-Id: I1b8c72b29a9a44a171aaa231aeb3533ccf41f7c2
Partial-bug: #1296913

commit_message:
xen plugin change to handle old style images

Traverse the staging_path recursively for vhd files
to convert them to new style, after downloading
image in xen plugin.

There are some old style images which are downloaded as
folder with vhd files.

Fixes bug 1294587
Change-Id: Icc97bd33603de07134ffb68e9058ae8a9b0c2f2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/81516/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Traverse the staging_path recursively for vhd files. There are some old style images which are downloaded as folder with vhd files. for root, sub_folders, files in os.walk(staging_path): for filename in ('snap.vhd', 'image.vhd', 'base.vhd'): if filename in files: path = os.path.join(root, filename) _rename(path, os.path.join(staging_path, "%d.vhd" % file_num)) file_num += 1
deleted_lines: for filename in ('snap.vhd', 'image.vhd', 'base.vhd'): path = os.path.join(staging_path, filename) if os.path.exists(path): _rename(path, os.path.join(staging_path, "%d.vhd" % file_num)) file_num += 1

commit_message:
Add cli client fro ostf adapter

Cli client for ostf adapter was added. Main features:
 * docopt module is using for command line arguments parsing
 * clint and blessings are using for advanced terminal output formatting
 * listing of available testsets and tests for given cluster are added
 * running of testrun for given cluster are added
 * stopping of running testrun are added via KeyboardInterrunpt handling

Not implemented but required features:
 * possibility to start particular tests for given testset
 * restarting action

Code is not working properly in all aspects so this work is in progress.

Change-Id: I382c67bf0e4552cbd227ecd30f8c64cecd32aebd
Implements: blueprint ostf-adapter-cli-client

commit_message:
LDAP global roles and group roles assignments

The list_role_assignments() function on LDAP assignment backend only
returns users roles assignments, not groups roles assignments.
Allowing to obtain group role assignments too, we can achieve that a
user can access to a project through a group.

Also, this patch allow to assign a role to a user without a tenant
(global role).

Change-Id: I27a4c841b8f2c66e2b72ca406f354b02040d3510
Co-Authored-By: Jose Castro Leon <jose.castro.leon@cern.ch>
Closes-Bug: #1285065
Closes-Bug: #1285136

added_lines: def _get_global_roles_for_group(group_id): return [self.role._dn_to_id(a.role_dn) for a in self.role.list_global_roles_for_group (self.group._id_to_dn(group_id))] def _get_global_roles_for_user(user_id): return [self.role._dn_to_id(a.role_dn) for a in self.role.list_global_roles_for_user (self.user._id_to_dn(user_id))] metadata_ref = [] # Adding user roles by tenant if tenant_id: for r in _get_roles_for_just_user_and_project(user_id, tenant_id): metadata_ref.append(r) # Adding global roles for user for r in _get_global_roles_for_user(user_id): metadata_ref.append(r) tenant_dn = None if tenant_id: self.get_project(tenant_id) tenant_dn = self.project._id_to_dn(tenant_id) tenant_dn = None if tenant_id: self.get_project(tenant_id) tenant_dn = self.project._id_to_dn(tenant_id) tenant_dn = self.project._id_to_dn(tenant_id) if tenant_id else None tenant_dn, user_id, role_id) tenant_dn = self.project._id_to_dn(tenant_id) if tenant_id else None tenant_dn, group_id, role_id) for a in self.role.list_role_assignments(self.project.tree_dn, self.user.tree_dn, self.group.tree_dn): if isinstance(a, UserRoleAssociation): assignment = {'role_id': self.role._dn_to_id(a.role_dn), 'user_id': self.user._dn_to_id(a.user_dn), 'project_id': self.project._dn_to_id( a.project_dn)} else: assignment = {'role_id': self.role._dn_to_id(a.role_dn), 'group_id': self.group._dn_to_id(a.group_dn), 'project_id': self.project._dn_to_id( a.project_dn)} def list_global_roles_for_group(self, group_dn): roles = self.get_all('(%s=%s)' % (self.member_attribute, group_dn)) return [GroupRoleAssociation( role_dn=self._id_to_dn(role['id']), group_dn=group_dn) for role in roles] role_dn=self._id_to_dn(role['id']), def list_role_assignments(self, project_tree_dn, user_tree_dn, group_tree_dn): # NOTE(marcos-fermin-lobo): In Active Directory, for functions # such as "self.role.get_role_assignments", it returns # the key "CN" or "OU" in uppercase. # The group_dn var has "CN" and "OU" in lowercase. # For this reason, it is necessary to use the "upper()" # function so both are consistent. for user_dn in role[self.member_attribute]: if user_tree_dn.upper() in user_dn.upper(): res.append(UserRoleAssociation(user_dn=user_dn, role_dn=role_dn, tenant_dn=tenant_dn)) if group_tree_dn.upper() in user_dn.upper(): res.append(GroupRoleAssociation(group_dn=user_dn, role_dn=role_dn, tenant_dn=tenant_dn))

commit_message:
Detecting unexpectedly not deleted resources

This is the initial part of handling the resource leakage issues.
This part aims to handle the tenant/project related resources,
but  not the possible 'tenant' leakage issue itself.

The leaked tenant in parallel run can be handled only at_axit or after
test suite finishes.

These cleanup oprtations acts before the tenant deletion.

TODO: Handle more resource resource type
TODO: Add the 'in tenant' resource handler to more test type
TODO: Collect and store all tenant creation for post cleanup
TODO: Use the same code with stress cleanup utility
Change-Id: I5dcacf4ff270a0d3ecbf5d628f0b62347344d09e

commit_message:
[WIP] Support use of id or name when referring to resources

* Support use of image name or id in NovaServers benchmark
* Replace use of image id with name in all Nova tasks
* Support use of flavor name or id in NovaServers benchmark
* Replace use of flavor id with name in all Nova tasks

Change-Id: I81e8efa71200aa8acd76a64efdfff7ee0ab1fc85

commit_message:
Compare metadata with database state

Using alembic internal api generate diff between
db state and metadata

There was bug with sqlalchemy reflection engine, that does not work
properly with UniqueConstraints.
It should fail with sqlalchemy<0.8.4, so we need to bump version.

Change-Id: I512d20dff5379e8e0fd1b2e05465bfc8c7e4e006
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/03/73203/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import pprint from alembic import autogenerate from alembic import migration from nailgun.test import base from nailgun.db import sqlalchemy class TestMigrationsInSync(base.BaseIntegrationTest): def test_migrations_in_sync_with_metadata(self): """Uses same tools that enables autogeneration of migration scripts """ metadata = sqlalchemy.models.base.Base.metadata engine = sqlalchemy.engine migration_context = migration.MigrationContext.configure( engine.connect()) diff = autogenerate.compare_metadata(migration_context, metadata) if diff: formated_diff = pprint.pformat(diff, indent=2, width=20) self.fail('Migration arent in sync ' 'with database state:\n{0}'.format(formated_diff))

commit_message:
Fix Marconi issues when running against devstack gate

This patch is to get marconi running in devstack with sqlalchemy
driver.

Change-Id: Id2a8d0ea7a0b9873b78c3b806c1107d4d70b7569

subject: Fix FibreChannel detach devices key issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-05 18:55:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3041d4cd86e5e2659f9d88e89b9a839d76160f5c', 'message': 'Fix FibreChannel detach devices key issue

This fixes the exception at detach time where the
devices key was missing from the connection_info.

This patch removes the reliance of the devices key
in the connection_info, which comes from the
block_device_mapping.  Unfortunately, nova has
many places where it calls the driver to attach
and detach LUNs from the system, and not all of those
places update/save the updated connection_info
in the block_device_mapping table.
A normal volume attach to a vm does update the
block_device_mapping table, so the devices key existed
at detach time.   A boot vm from volume does not update
the block_device_mapping after the attach call, so the
devices key was missing.

Change-Id: I83f9b7d22921caa048cf6d230e3e2c9267ce06b0
Closes-Bug: #1288360
'}]
commit_message:
Fix FibreChannel detach devices key issue

This fixes the exception at detach time where the
devices key was missing from the connection_info.

This patch removes the reliance of the devices key
in the connection_info, which comes from the
block_device_mapping.  Unfortunately, nova has
many places where it calls the driver to attach
and detach LUNs from the system, and not all of those
places update/save the updated connection_info
in the block_device_mapping table.
A normal volume attach to a vm does update the
block_device_mapping table, so the devices key existed
at detach time.   A boot vm from volume does not update
the block_device_mapping after the attach call, so the
devices key was missing.

Change-Id: I83f9b7d22921caa048cf6d230e3e2c9267ce06b0
Closes-Bug: #1288360
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/78358/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: connection_info['data']['devices'] = mdev_info['devices'] connection_info['data']['devices'] = [device_info] devices = connection_info['data']['devices'] LOG.debug(_("devices to remove = %s"), devices)

commit_message:
Adding FlashSystem 840 Cinder driver

This driver will currently support interfacing a single host direct
attached to an IBM FlashSystem 840 and fully supports Create, Delete,
Extend, Attach, and Detach.

Change-Id: Idcab638a9ca30b87fdb70f7c571c22788b0d4c5d
Implements: blueprint add-flashsystem-svc

commit_message:
Show nvalid data string error info of statistics

When getting statistics of a meter with invalid data string in query,
the ceilometer CLI return 'HTTPInternalServerError', it should return the
details of the date string validation error.

Change-Id: I6e66c286b4b41a3ec05c61d046201b3b32614d94
Closes-bug: #1270394

commit_message:
Trove Manual Installation guide

Installation of Trove on a VM different from the controller node.
The openstack environment is Havana.
The Keystone service accepts only HTTPS connections.

According to the redstack script:
 - commands related to the datastore creation/configuration are updated.
 - details on the configuration files are provided.

	deleted:    trove_manual_installation.rst

Change-Id: I09b29354be0e0d4f1b7e629324eb43377eb1077f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/53/81953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: =============================== Trove manual installation guide =============================== Scenario ======== 1) An OpenStack environment (No DEVSTACK/REDSTACK) with a Keystone service that accepts HTTPS connection. 2) Trove works on fresh new Ubuntu 12.04 VM. Base configuration ================== On the VM that will host the Trove service, execute a base configuration like the other OpenStack services (http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/install-guide/install/apt/content/ch_basics.html) installing only the NTP protocol and set the password for Trove. Installation ============ -------------------- Install dependencies -------------------- Log in as root user and execute the following commands: * Install required packages:: # apt-get install build-essential libxslt1-dev qemu-utils mysql-client git python-dev python-pexpect python-mysqldb libmysqlclient-dev * Some packages in Ubuntu repo are outdated, so install their latest version from sources:: # cd ~ # wget https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/s/setuptools/setuptools-0.9.8.tar.gz # tar xfvz setuptools-0.9.8.tar.gz # cd setuptools-0.9.8 # python setup.py install # cd ~ # wget https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/p/pip/pip-1.4.1.tar.gz # tar xfvz pip-1.4.1.tar.gz # cd pip-1.4.1 # python setup.py install # cd ~ You should use the last versions on https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/s/setuptools/ and https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/p/pip/ ------------ Obtain Trove ------------ * Get Trove's sources from git:: # git clone https://github.com/openstack/trove.git # git clone https://github.com/openstack/python-troveclient.git ------------- Install Trove ------------- * First install the required python packages:: # cd ~/trove # pip install -r requirements.txt * Install Trove itself:: # python setup.py develop * Install python-troveclient:: # cd ~/python-troveclient # python setup.py develop # cd ~ * We'll need glance client as well:: # pip install python-glanceclient Prepare OpenStack ----------------- * Create a tenant 'trove' and user 'trove' with password 'trove' to be used with Trove:: Create tenant # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ tenant-create --name trove Creat user: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ user-create --name trove --pass trove --tenant trove Role, admin and user association: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ user-role-add --user trove --tenant trove --role admin Adding the user trove to the tenant service: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ user-role-add --user trove --tenant service --role admin * Create service trove: # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ service-create --name trove --type database * Create endpoint that points to trove. Pay attention to the use of quotes ('): # keystone --os-username <OpenStackAdminUsername> --os-password <OpenStackAdminPassword> \ --os-tenant-name <OpenStackAdminTenant> \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 endpoint-create \ --service-id trove_service_id \ --publicurl 'http://IP_trove:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s' \ --adminurl 'http://IP_trove:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s' \ --internalurl 'http://IP_trove:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s' Prepare Trove configuration files --------------------------------- There are configuration files for Trove services (each file named as the actual service): * api-paste.ini and trove.conf.sample - for trove-api * trove-taskmanager.conf.sample - for trove-taskmanager * trove-guestagent.conf.sample - for trove-guestagent * <datastore_type>.cloudinit - cloudinit scripts for different service types. For now only 'mysql' and 'percona' are recognized as valid service types. NOTE: file names must exactly follow the pattern, e.g. 'mysql.cloudinit' Samples above are available in $TROVE/trove/etc/trove/ as *.conf.sample files. If a vanilla Ubuntu image used as a source image for Trove instances, then it is cloudinit script's responsibility to install and run Trove guestagent in the instance. As an alternative one may consider creating a custom image with pre-installed and pre-configured Trove in it. * Edit the trove.conf.sample and trove-taskmanager.conf.sample files, adding the Rabbit Hostname for AMQP:: # AMQP Connection info rabbit_password = RABBIT_PASSWORD rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST * Edit the api-paste.ini file adding some rows: Comment the admin_token string and insert the following: [filter:authtoken] paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory auth_host = KEYSTONE_HOST auth_port = 35357 auth_protocol = https #admin_token = xxxxxxxxxxxxxx admin_user = trove admin_password = trove admin_tenant_name = service auth_uri = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:5000/v2.0 # signing_dir is configurable, but the default behavior of the authtoken # middleware should be sufficient. It will create a temporary directory # in the home directory for the user the trove process is running as. signing_dir = /root/trove/etc/trove/ * Edit the trove.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] default_datastore = mysql use_syslog = False ..... # SQLAlchemy connection string for the reference implementation # registry server. Any valid SQLAlchemy connection string is fine. # See: http://www.sqlalchemy.org/docs/05/reference/sqlalchemy/connections.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 .... trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:5000/v2.0 nova_compute_url = http://COMPUTE_HOST:8774/v2 cinder_url = http://CINDER_HOST:8776/v1 swift_url = http://SWIFT_HOST:8080/v1/AUTH_ .... # Config option for showing the IP address that nova doles out add_addresses = True network_label_regex = ^NETWORK_LABEL$ .... # ============ notifer queue kombu connection options ======================== notifier_queue_hostname = RABBIT_HOST ... * Edit the trove-taskmanager.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] use_syslog = False ..... # SQLAlchemy connection string for the reference implementation # registry server. Any valid SQLAlchemy connection string is fine. # See: http://www.sqlalchemy.org/docs/05/reference/sqlalchemy/connections.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 .... trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:5000/v2.0 nova_compute_url = http://COMPUTE_HOST:8774/v2 cinder_url = http://CINDER_HOST:8776/v1 swift_url = http://SWIFT_HOST:8080/v1/AUTH_ .... # Configuration options for talking to nova via the novaclient. # These options are for an admin user in your keystone config. # It proxy's the token received from the user to send to nova via this admin users creds, # basically acting like the client via that proxy token. nova_proxy_admin_user = NOVA_USERNAME nova_proxy_admin_pass = NOVA_PASSWORD nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name = service .... # ============ notifer queue kombu connection options ======================== notifier_queue_hostname = RABBIT_HOST ... # ================= Guestagent related ======================== #guest_config = $pybasedir/etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample # Uncomment and set the cloudinit_location if it is different from '/etc/trove/cloudinit' (eg. /root/trove/etc/trove/cloudinit) #cloudinit_location = /etc/trove/cloudinit * Edit the trove-conductor.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] use_syslog = False ..... trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:35357/v2.0 nova_proxy_admin_user = NOVA_USERNAME nova_proxy_admin_pass = NOVA_PASSWORD nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name = service sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 # AMQP Connection info rabbit_password = guest rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST * Edit the trove-guestagent.conf.sample file adding some rows:: [DEFAULT] use_syslog = False sql_connection = mysql://trove:TROVE_DBPASS@TROVE_DB_HOST/trove?charset=utf8 ..... # AMQP Connection info rabbit_password = guest rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST # Configuration options for talking to nova via the novaclient. # These options are for an admin user in your keystone config. # It proxies the token received from the user to send to nova via this admin users creds, # basically acting like the client via that proxy token. trove_auth_url = https://KEYSTONE_HOST:35357/v2.0 swift_url = http://SWIFT_HOST:8080/v1/AUTH_ nova_proxy_admin_user = NOVA_USERNAME nova_proxy_admin_pass = NOVA_PASSWORD nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name = service .... # ============ kombu connection options ======================== rabbit_host = RABBIT_HOST_IP * Create a mysql.cloudinit file in order to install both trove guestagent and mysql server into the instance that will be created. Prepare image ------------- * As the source image for trove instances, we will use a cloudinit-based vanilla Ubuntu image:: # wget http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/precise/current/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img * Convert the downloaded image into uncompressed qcow2:: # qemu-img convert -O qcow2 precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img precise.qcow2 * Upload the converted image into Glance using the command line tool interface:: # glance --os-username trove --os-password trove --os-tenant-name trove \ --os-auth-url http://<KeystoneIp>:35357/v2.0 \ image-create --name ubuntu_mysql --public --container-format ovf --disk-format qcow2 --owner trove < precise.qcow2 You can do it also using the dashobord. Prepare database ---------------- * Create the datatabase. Create the Trove's database where it is more appropriate for you (in the controller node, in the Trove's VM, etc...):: # mysql -u root -p mysql> CREATE DATABASE trove; mysql> GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'localhost' \ IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS'; mysql> GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON trove.* TO trove@'%' \ IDENTIFIED BY 'TROVE_DBPASS'; * Inizialize the database:: # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> db_wipe mysql As an alternative, you can use: # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> db_sync * Access to Trove's database and insert the following rows:: mysql> INSERT INTO datastores VALUES ('a00000a0-00a0-0a00-00a0-000a000000aa', 'mysql', 'b00000b0-00b0-0b00-00b0-000b000000bb'); mysql> INSERT INTO datastores values ('e00000e0-00e0-0e00-00e0-000e000000ee', 'Test_Datastore_1', ''); mysql> INSERT INTO datastore_versions VALUES ('b00000b0-00b0-0b00-00b0-000b000000bb', 'a00000a0-00a0-0a00-00a0-000a000000aa', 'mysql-5.5', 'c00000c0-00c0-0c00-00c0-000c000000cc', 'mysql-server-5.5', 1, 'mysql'); mysql> INSERT INTO datastore_versions VALUES ('d00000d0-00d0-0d00-00d0-000d000000dd', 'a00000a0-00a0-0a00-00a0-000a000000aa', 'mysql_inactive_version', '', '', 0, 'manager1'); * Setup trove to use the uploaded image: Retrive id_image from nova:: # nova --os-username trove --os-password trove --os-tenant-name trove --os-auth-url http://keystone_IP:5000/v2.0 image-list | awk '/ubuntu_mysql/ {print $2}' Update datastore:: # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_update mysql "" # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_version_update mysql mysql-5.5 mysql image_id mysql-server-5.5 1 # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_version_update mysql mysql_inactive_version manager1 image_id "" 0 # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_update mysql mysql-5.5 # trove-manage --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> datastore_update Test_Datastore_1 "" Run Trove ---------- Run the following commands:: # trove-api --config-file=<PathToTroveConf> & # trove-taskmanager --config-file=<PathToTroveTaskmanager> & # trove-conductor --config-file=<PathToTroveConductor> & Try executing a trove command ----------------------------- * Create a troverc file with the following commands:: export OS_USERNAME=trove export OS_PASSWORD=trove export OS_TENANT_NAME=trove export OS_AUTH_URL=https://keystone_host.it:5000/v2.0 export OS_CACERT=/path/to/file/.pem * Source the troverc file:: # source troverc * Retrive the instances list:: # trove list # trove show instance_id Troubleshooting =============== No instance IPs in the output of 'trove show' -------------------------------------------- If Trove instance is created properly, and it is in the state ACTIVE, and is known for sure to be working, but there are no IP addresses for the instance in the output of 'trove show instance_id', then make sure the following lines are added to trove.conf.sample file:: add_addresses = True network_label_regex = ^NETWORK_NAME$ where NETWORK_NAME should be replaced with real name of the nova network to which the instance is connected to. One possible way to find the nova network name is to execute the 'nova list' command. The output will list all OpenStack instances for the tenant, including network information. Look for: NETWORK_NAME=IP_ADDRESS Suggestions =========== ...

commit_message:
Update quota-set throw 500 error

The server doesn't check whether the parameter "quota_set" or
"quota_class_set" is in request
body.So the 500 error has been thrown.

We should catch the KeyError and transfer the KeyError to
400(HTTPBadRequest) instead of 500.

Closes-Bug: #1249971
(cherry picked from commit 2ed2f3aff8eee70e02eb995780af292057cfcad4)
Change-Id: I01260c77efa50324f3d203888689cdb1e94d2c21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/08/64008/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_update_without_quota_set_field(self): body = {'fake_quota_set': {'gigabytes': 100}} self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, self.req, 'foo', body) def test_update_empty_body(self): body = {} self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, self.req, 'foo', body)

commit_message:
NetApp fix for vsadmin role failure for ssc

The ssc feature does not work with vserver admin
role. If the user is a vsadmin then he does cannot
use the ssc feature fully. This fix checks the access
and issues apis appropriately and also handles error
conditions.

Closes-Bug: #1253657

Change-Id: Ibc4409e5d5e6e36bba41e5f59dd94c05b87b1cde
(cherry picked from commit 20667f7d49eed88ddd528be73293a624b3af1ba0)

commit_message:
Ensure the correct error message is displayed

When a untranslated error message pass through the translation pecan
hook, the previous translated error is send to the client.

This patch fix that by reseting the "translatable_error" of the
translation pecan hook before each request.

Conflicts:

    tests/api/v2/test_app.py

Change-Id: Icee79cf09fd696655048c7c0cf8a3d6706e31701
Fixes: bug #1260398
(cherry picked from commit 02d017022bab577b581b58f42b468bf0b2c644a9)

Cinder generally does not allow upload-to-image operation on a volume
that is 'in-use'. This can however be over-ridden using the '--force True'
flag. The VMware driver cannot support upload-to-image when the volume is
in-use. This is a restriction for the VMware driver alone. When the user forces

scenario the VMware driver needs to fail the operation.

status of 'in-use'. Fixing this check to identify an in-use volume correctly.

commit_message:
VMware: Fixed upload-to-image for available volume

Cinder generally does not allow upload-to-image operation on a volume
that is 'in-use'. This can however be over-ridden using the '--force True'
flag. The VMware driver cannot support upload-to-image when the volume is
in-use. This is a restriction for the VMware driver alone. When the user forces
an upload on a volume that is 'in-use' the Cinder api layer sets the volume
status to 'uploading' and calls into the driver code to upload. In this
scenario the VMware driver needs to fail the operation.

The current driver code here does this check wrongly by looking for volume
status of 'in-use'. Fixing this check to identify an in-use volume correctly.

Fixes bug: 1237338

(cherry picked from commit a2b774c0ce2a1aaa9cdfc7d7c4c4d642f1bfc3d1)

Change-Id: If54edfdc242a7a1bff442b6bb4c5a9865eede1dc

commit_message:
glance requires pyOpenSSL>=0.11

glance uses  OpenSSL.crypto.sign() and OpenSSL.crypto.verify(), which
are new in pyOpenSSL 0.11. Global requirements already fixed, do the
same change in glance

Change-Id: I20ba38a174548c5a5a501351fb9a1a33b235b0b4

subject: Subnets should be set as lazy='join'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 23:15:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/models_v2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/566321be3fe981cdb7ee3f89420719626ad65484', 'message': "Subnets should be set as lazy='join'

Currently if one does a net-list tons of queries are issued against the
database as the default query mode is 'select' which performs a query when
the field is actually accessed. In this patch I change the the mode to
'joined' so subnets are loaded as the networks are loaded. Usually, there
are only 1 or 2 subnets on a network so loading this data shouldn't hurt.
This patch in my setup with 5000 networks reduces the net-list call from 27
seconds to 7! Woot Woot :)

Change-Id: I10eec4d79b522dfd685d3d2aa93a8d643104bba7
Closes-bug: 1298053
(cherry picked from commit cbeda85fe5284d2ec0ba39976cdf6ffcdfbdd84a)
"}]
commit_message:
Subnets should be set as lazy='join'

Currently if one does a net-list tons of queries are issued against the
database as the default query mode is 'select' which performs a query when
the field is actually accessed. In this patch I change the the mode to
'joined' so subnets are loaded as the networks are loaded. Usually, there
are only 1 or 2 subnets on a network so loading this data shouldn't hurt.
This patch in my setup with 5000 networks reduces the net-list call from 27
seconds to 7! Woot Woot :)

Change-Id: I10eec4d79b522dfd685d3d2aa93a8d643104bba7
Closes-bug: 1298053
(cherry picked from commit cbeda85fe5284d2ec0ba39976cdf6ffcdfbdd84a)

commit_message:
Fix issue deleting ec2-credentials as non-admin user

The ec2tokens controller incorrectly uses the access id, not the
hashed credential id in _assert_owner, which means that non-admin
users can't delete their ec2-credentials.  Adding the hashing, as
in _get_credentials fixes the problem.  Test added demonstrating
the issue.

Change-Id: Ifb6e3e10a50541cf21d25880bd74e9aeb6df4f26
Closes-Bug: #1245435
(cherry picked from commit 85ca6ac8a7fab14c659673ddf47777badcbcbf04)

subject: Pass thru credentials to allow re-authentication
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-31 13:34:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0b16587165005d9c75c484f60ed9d71461ff9ff2', 'message': "Pass thru credentials to allow re-authentication

Nova's network client obtains a token from keystone for authenitcation
to the neutron services.  When the timeout of keystone is set low, it
creates a condition where some of the invocations to neutron start
failing.

This is because the neutron client detects that the token is expired,
but during the re-authorization attempt fails due to not having enough
information to properly reauthorize.  Nova also assumes that within a
given context, the token will always be valid.  It does not perform the
authorization check (and doing so would be double verification as the
neutron client is already validating this).

Since the neutron client has logic in place to re-authorize the token,
this change set will pass thru the credentials to the neutron client
for the re-authorization attempts.  This change also updates the unit
tests.

Note: the change only will pass in the admin credential information
if the context indicates that it is an admin.

Change-Id: I2858562b180f3e058a2da9d67bef02af80927177
Closes-Bug: #1241275
(cherry picked from commit 51e5f52e4cb60e266ccde71f205c91eb8c97b48b)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-01 00:01:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/89deffe669d4bd55ea0df217e7d9021eeb42425a', 'message': "Pass thru credentials to allow re-authentication

Nova's network client obtains a token from keystone for authenitcation
to the neutron services.  When the timeout of keystone is set low, it
creates a condition where some of the invocations to neutron start
failing.

This is because the neutron client detects that the token is expired,
but during the re-authorization attempt fails due to not having enough
information to properly reauthorize.  Nova also assumes that within a
given context, the token will always be valid.  It does not perform the
authorization check (and doing so would be double verification as the
neutron client is already validating this).

Since the neutron client has logic in place to re-authorize the token,
this change set will pass thru the credentials to the neutron client
for the re-authorization attempts.  This change also updates the unit
tests.

Note: the change only will pass in the admin credential information
if the context indicates that it is an admin.

NOTE(mriedem): This entire topic branch must be backported together
or none at all since they all build on each other for a single fix.

Change-Id: I2858562b180f3e058a2da9d67bef02af80927177
Closes-Bug: #1241275
(cherry picked from commit 51e5f52e4cb60e266ccde71f205c91eb8c97b48b)

commit_message:
Pass thru credentials to allow re-authentication

This is a backport of 4 fixes squashed into one because:

1. They need to all be merged together as they build on each
   other as problems were found in each change after it was
   merged on master.
2. The 3rd change won't pass Jenkins on it's own so it has
   to be squashed with the 4th and final change, so I'm just
   going to squash the entire topic branch together.

The change bugs fixed and cherry pick commit hashes are left
intact for each change.

Closes-Bug: #1241275
(cherry picked from commit 51e5f52e4cb60e266ccde71f205c91eb8c97b48b)

Cache Neutron Client for Admin Scenarios

Closes-Bug: #1250580
(cherry picked from commit 85332012dede96fa6729026c2a90594ea0502ac5)

Users with admin role in Nova should not re-auth with Neutron

Closes-Bug: 1250763
(cherry picked from commit 1c1371c78b990447aeaa4377b512f8887e6ff3ce)

Fix Neutron Authentication for Metadata Service

Closes-Bug:  1255577
(cherry picked from commit 652620d12f3afe6845e41d9762b52d23f44fd557)

============

Change-Id: I2858562b180f3e058a2da9d67bef02af80927177

commit_message:
Reduce number of novaclient calls

Currently, each client creates a new session for
each call. This fix makes novaclient re-use
sessions in the most obvoius cases.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py

Partial-Bug: #1247056

Change-Id: Ie99ecb66304cf40e4f5fdd31fab5162ed11b863e
(cherry picked from commit ddc479272f5402ff778c45892acc3ac7613b7c11)

commit_message:
Migrate invalid template version values

If a stack was created with a template that specified an invalid time,
a variety of operations cannot be done on the stack, resulting in a
general breakage of Heat.  This patch migrates any occurances of version
numbers that are invalid that were specified prior to the merging of this
patch.  This patch also handles invalid version fields where a non-date
is specified or an invalid date was specified.

Change-Id: I5387ffb84dba5160103b3cb02f3d1cc5f352ff29
Closes-bug: 1296859

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import time from migrate.versioning import util as migrate_util from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker from heat.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ from heat.db.sqlalchemy import models def upgrade(migrate_engine): Session = sessionmaker(bind=migrate_engine) session = Session() raw_templates = session.query(models.RawTemplate).all() # NOTE (sdake) 2014-03-26 is the date of this change. For stacks # with version dates in the future, they remain unlistable # This is to prevent future breakage when new versions come out patch_date = time.strptime('2014-03-26', '%Y-%m-%d') for raw_template in raw_templates: if 'heat_template_version' in raw_template.template: template = copy.deepcopy(raw_template.template) version = template['heat_template_version'] try: dt = time.strptime(version, '%Y-%m-%d') except ValueError: dt = None if dt is None or dt < patch_date: template['heat_template_version'] = '2013-05-23' raw_template.template = template session.commit() if 'AWSTemplateFormatVersion' in raw_template.template: template = copy.deepcopy(raw_template.template) version = template['AWSTemplateFormatVersion'] try: dt = time.strptime(version, '%Y-%m-%d') except ValueError: dt = None if dt is None or dt < patch_date: template['AWSTempalteFormatVersion'] = '2010-09-09' raw_template.template = template session.commit() if 'HeatTemplateFormatVersion' in raw_template.template: template = copy.deepcopy(raw_template.template) version = template['HeatTemplateFormatVersion'] try: dt = time.strptime(version, '%Y-%m-%d') except ValueError: dt = None if dt is None or dt < patch_date: template['HeatTemplateFormatVersion'] = '2012-12-12' raw_template.template = template session.commit() def downgrade(migrate_engine): migrate_util.log.warning(_('This version cannot be downgraded because ' 'it involves a data migration to the ' 'raw_template table.'))

commit_message:
Use AccessInfo in auth_token middleware

auth_token middleware parses the token and extracts the data manually.
We have this parsing ability in AccessInfo now so we should use that
instead.

Change-Id: I23c6e33d327c3d3669fb977d9623b788324c4785

commit_message:
GlusterFS: Fix deadlock in volume clone

The create_cloned_volume path could deadlock due to
create_cloned_volume and create/delete_snapshot using the same
lock for synchronization.

Refactor the calls to create/delete snapshot to call the inner
method which does not use a lock.

Introduced by "06999f6 GlusterFS: Synchronize additional op..."

Related-Bug: 1267983
Closes-Bug: 1272092

(cherry picked from commit e9722f09dfd4b58e40afbf285ab9a7738a641dca)

Note: Effectively includes most changes from "8772714 Pylint fixes ..."
to resolve conflicts.
(cherry picked from commit 8772714b4fcb2d05ae7f0bfe5cfd0fa660ab9100)

Conflicts:
        cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py

Change-Id: I84ca34b201c10644faa047f1c9274c14bcdd0359

subject: GlusterFS: Synchronize additional operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 18:04:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e0dca033349f20c5c1de7bdda93159ac0735eb36', 'message': 'GlusterFS: Synchronize additional operations

create_cloned_volume() and copy_volume_to_image() should also be
locked against other driver operations to prevent collisions
from concurrent updates of snapshot metadata or volume file data.

commit_message:
GlusterFS: Synchronize additional operations

create_cloned_volume() and copy_volume_to_image() should also be
locked against other driver operations to prevent collisions
from concurrent updates of snapshot metadata or volume file data.

Closes-Bug: #1267983

(cherry picked from commit 06999f610afc3a123f7a54895e39d690301a8eba)

Change-Id: Idd6158bfbe4dc049c33fa58b40d3d570fc244d01

commit_message:
Use CMS to generate sample tokens

This is preparing for compressed tokens.  We don't want anything in the
keystone server tree that assumes it knows the formats of the token.
This uses the CMS code to preduce the sample data.

Change-Id: I6bf9c0f8df2e2e6d53fef4ecbcca87b9f9af4e6b

commit_message:
Adds "add_dhcp_agent" to test_dhcp_agent_scheduler

This submission is to verify add-dhcp-agent-to-network functionality
and also added required support functions in both XML/JSON interfaces.

Change-Id: I6e9f8336db6d72b1123220f792091ca17b1b1647
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/68597/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @attr(type='smoke') def test_add_dhcp_agent_to_network(self): resp, body = self.admin_client.list_agents() agents = body['agents'] for a in agents: if a['agent_type'] == 'DHCP agent': agent = a new_network = self.create_network() network_id = new_network['id'] resp, body = self.admin_client.add_dhcp_agent_to_network( agent['id'], network_id) self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '201') self.assertTrue(self._check_network_in_dhcp_agent( network_id, agent)) resp, body = self.admin_client.remove_network_from_dhcp_agent( agent_id=agent['id'], network_id=network_id) self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '204') self.assertFalse(self._check_network_in_dhcp_agent( network_id, agent))

commit_message:
Allows override of stdout/stderr/log capturing

During a test run stdout, stderr and log messages are being captured. If
the test fails all three will be printed out so that can be inspected.
Each stream has an environment variable that can be used to stop it from
being printed at the end of a test run by setting its value to 0. This
is in line with what many of the other project are already doing.

Environment variables:

 - OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE for stdout
 - OS_STDERR_CAPTURE for stderr
 - OS_LOG_CAPTURE for logging

Change-Id: I2fed99069950b839e060297026c8e06cbd45bb98

commit_message:
Start using to oslotest

oslotest provides a BaseTestCase class then enables proper capturing of
stdout, stderr and logging streams during a test run. We will take
advantage of this capability in the near future.

Change-Id: I16761053f631e709224eee813dc0f423f06c8870

commit_message:
Remove the update default quotas feature

The default quota panel has been moved to a tab in the system
info panel.
The update default quotas feature has been removed.
The cinder quota-class methods have been removed to keep consistency.
The test cases and the apis for nova and cinder have been modified
according the change.

This change is done to support the change:
I1110022d6f628d03aaf363da707f2d2ef1600437

Change-Id: I193c7209d9681b6d69afe0d996153ac86850d243
Closes-Bug: #1292589

commit_message:
Check create/delete keypair attribute of Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON Schema for response of Nova V2 & V3
create & delete keypair APIs and validate the response with
added JSON Schema to block the backward incompatibility change
in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 create_keypairs APIs is same and
given below:

{
    "keypair": {
        "fingerprint": "%(fingerprint)s",
        "name": "%(keypair_name)s",
        "public_key": "%(public_key)s",
        "user_id": "fake",
        "private_key": "%(private_key)s"
    }
}

Response status code differ for create and delete keypairs

V2 - create_keypair = 200
V2 - delete_keypair = 202
V3 - create_keypair = 201
V3 - delete_keypair = 204

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I179f0f11a43324d81ecbb41c0eae2f7072e8979a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/64/82464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.validate_response(schema.create_keypair, resp, body) resp, body = self.delete("os-keypairs/%s" % str(key_name)) self.validate_response(schema.delete_keypair, resp, body) return resp, body

commit_message:
Fix service API and cells

The move to the object model broke the service API when used together
with cells. The underlying problem is how cells will overload the id
field with a cell path to uniquely identify each service in each cell.

Changing the id to a string would defeat the purpose of the object model
so this patch uses a proxy to modify the id on access to make the
difference transparent to the API.

Change-Id: I165b5d64b0c1556511eb02d179ca9fc6f101c008
Closes-bug: 1251043

commit_message:
Add unit tests for debug

This commit adds unit tests for common.debug.

Partially implements bp unit-tests

Change-Id: I3ab573942293eea72294d395ae40e92c2126708d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/15/80915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 NEC Corporation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from tempest.common import debug from tempest import config from tempest.openstack.common.fixture import mockpatch from tempest import test from tempest.tests import base from tempest.tests import fake_config class TestDebug(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestDebug, self).setUp() self.useFixture(fake_config.ConfigFixture()) self.stubs.Set(config, 'TempestConfigPrivate', fake_config.FakePrivate) common_pre = 'tempest.common.commands' self.ip_addr_raw_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.ip_addr_raw') self.ip_route_raw_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.ip_route_raw') self.iptables_raw_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.iptables_raw') self.ip_ns_list_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.ip_ns_list') self.ip_ns_addr_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.ip_ns_addr') self.ip_ns_route_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.ip_ns_route') self.iptables_ns_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.iptables_ns') self.ovs_db_dump_mock = self.patch(common_pre + '.ovs_db_dump') self.log_mock = self.patch('tempest.common.debug.LOG') def test_log_ip_ns_debug_disabled(self): self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.debug, 'enable', False)) debug.log_ip_ns() self.assertFalse(self.ip_addr_raw_mock.called) self.assertFalse(self.log_mock.info.called) def test_log_ip_ns_debug_enabled(self): self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.debug, 'enable', True)) tables = ['filter', 'nat', 'mangle'] self.ip_ns_list_mock.return_value = [1, 2] debug.log_ip_ns() self.ip_addr_raw_mock.assert_called_with() self.assertTrue(self.log_mock.info.called) self.ip_route_raw_mock.assert_called_with() self.assertEqual(len(tables), self.iptables_raw_mock.call_count) for table in tables: self.assertIn(mock.call(table), self.iptables_raw_mock.call_args_list) self.ip_ns_list_mock.assert_called_with() self.assertEqual(len(self.ip_ns_list_mock.return_value), self.ip_ns_addr_mock.call_count) self.assertEqual(len(self.ip_ns_list_mock.return_value), self.ip_ns_route_mock.call_count) for ns in self.ip_ns_list_mock.return_value: self.assertIn(mock.call(ns), self.ip_ns_addr_mock.call_args_list) self.assertIn(mock.call(ns), self.ip_ns_route_mock.call_args_list) self.assertEqual(len(tables) * len(self.ip_ns_list_mock.return_value), self.iptables_ns_mock.call_count) for ns in self.ip_ns_list_mock.return_value: for table in tables: self.assertIn(mock.call(ns, table), self.iptables_ns_mock.call_args_list) def test_log_ovs_db_debug_disabled(self): self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.debug, 'enable', False)) self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.service_available, 'neutron', False)) debug.log_ovs_db() self.assertFalse(self.ovs_db_dump_mock.called) self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.debug, 'enable', True)) self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.service_available, 'neutron', False)) debug.log_ovs_db() self.assertFalse(self.ovs_db_dump_mock.called) self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.debug, 'enable', False)) self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.service_available, 'neutron', True)) debug.log_ovs_db() self.assertFalse(self.ovs_db_dump_mock.called) def test_log_ovs_db_debug_enabled(self): self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.debug, 'enable', True)) self.useFixture(mockpatch.PatchObject(test.CONF.service_available, 'neutron', True)) debug.log_ovs_db() self.ovs_db_dump_mock.assert_called_with() def test_log_net_debug(self): self.log_ip_ns_mock = self.patch('tempest.common.debug.log_ip_ns') self.log_ovs_db_mock = self.patch('tempest.common.debug.log_ovs_db') debug.log_net_debug() self.log_ip_ns_mock.assert_called_with() self.log_ovs_db_mock.assert_called_with()

commit_message:
Updated to match semver and release notes.

Before this update the Modulefile was not following semver in
relation to stable/havana, and the README files were not in sync.
This update introduces proper semver and consistency.

Change-Id: I65fda078f20eb8d41b260c4550ac3c262cca8267
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/57/82257/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **3.0.0** * Major release for OpenStack Havana. * Fixed Puppet 3.x template variable deprecation warning. * Added swift operator roles to Keystone. * Defaults include_service_catalog to false for improved performance. * Fixed auth_token configuration. * Fixed filter name for puppetdb. * Added bulk middleware support. * Added quota middleware support. * Allow configuration of admin and internal protocols for keystone endpoint.

commit_message:
Add support to deploy-testenv for multiple environments

Includes configuration to build a heat stack of testenvs on the
HP, Red Hat and local devtest environments.

Requires: I1209f6b933446d0ad55096ef7d94f5b3c9114321

Change-Id: Ibdb59581adbfeb2e0fb9ec564c3b87ae6250653b

commit_message:
Add a new exception for invalid structure

This commit fixes too broad exception in output_parser. Otherwise, we
can't assert the Exception in unit tests.

Partially implements bp unit-tests

Change-Id: I9e45571dbf964a37dd9d0249a6f662216d5d046c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/27/80927/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 NEC Corporation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.cli import output_parser from tempest.tests import base class TestOutputParser(base.TestCase): OUTPUT_LINES = """ +----+------+---------+ | ID | Name | Status | +----+------+---------+ | 11 | foo | BUILD | | 21 | bar | ERROR | | 31 | bee | None | +----+------+---------+ """ EXPECTED_TABLE = {'headers': ['ID', 'Name', 'Status'], 'values': [['11', 'foo', 'BUILD'], ['21', 'bar', 'ERROR'], ['31', 'bee', 'None']]} def test_table_with_header_values(self): actual = output_parser.table(self.OUTPUT_LINES) self.assertIsInstance(actual, dict) self.assertEqual(self.EXPECTED_TABLE, actual) def test_table_with_list(self): output_lines = self.OUTPUT_LINES.split('\n') actual = output_parser.table(output_lines) self.assertIsInstance(actual, dict) self.assertEqual(self.EXPECTED_TABLE, actual) def test_table_with_invalid_line(self): output_lines = self.OUTPUT_LINES + "aaaa" print(output_lines) actual = output_parser.table(output_lines) self.assertIsInstance(actual, dict) self.assertEqual(self.EXPECTED_TABLE, actual)

commit_message:
Fix volume transfer href issue

The volume transfer collection in url defined as "os-volume-tranfer",
but I got another define "tranfers" in href url. They are different.
So it should be modify.

closes-bug: #1242980
Change-Id: I69a43012f2bb70ce5fc7b0331d2759527a261170
(cherry picked from commit b104d1c0c70898b59b6668970e05cebadecd064a)

added_lines: def delete(self, uuid): """Delete a language_pack.""" db_obj = objects.registry.LanguagePack.get_by_uuid(self.context, uuid) service_obj = objects.registry.Service.get_by_id(self.context, db_obj.service_id) session = db_session.get_session(mysql_traditional_mode=True) with session.begin(): db_obj.destroy(self.context) if not self.get_all(): service_obj.destroy(self.context)

commit_message:
Content for an application developer portal

Create a portal for application developers that links them to the resources
that developers need to build applications. It also makes the page layout
consistent with the rest of openstack.org.

Change-Id: I1ff2048cbba75231e5220c867ea78759a3d55cfe
Implements: blueprint developer-openstack-org

added_lines:
Join us at the next OpenStack Summit in Atlanta, May 12-16.    Summit Details

  • Home
  • Software
  • User Stories
  • Community
  • Foundation
  • Profile
  • Blog
  • Wiki
  • Documentation

    • Open source software for application development
    on private and public OpenStack clouds.

    You can interact with an OpenStack cloud using a number of tools. The one you choose will depend largely on your use case in the cloud.

    Software Development Kits
    Command Line Interfaces
    Application Programming Interfaces

    Software Development Kits

    A Software Development Kit (SDK) is a collection of code, examples, and documentation that helps you to create applications in the language of your choice on OpenStack clouds. If your language or use case isn't covered by one of the official SDKs below, you may need to use the API or one of the other Known SDKs.

    Official SDKs

    • Java
    • node.js
    • PHP
    • Ruby

    Java

    Official SDK
    Apache jclouds
    Docs and Resources
    Getting Started Guide
    SDK Reference Manual
    Release Notes
    Community Links
    Twitter: @jclouds
    IRC: #jclouds on irc.freenode.net
    Mailing List: Register | Archive
    Report Issues: Issue Tracker

    node.js

    Official SDK
    pkgcloud
    Docs and Resources
    Getting Started Guide
    SDK Reference Manual
    Release Notes
    Community Links
    Twitter: @pkgcloud
    IRC: #nodejitsu on irc.freenode.net
    Mailing List: GitHub Issues
    Report Issues: Issue Tracker

    PHP

    Official SDK
    PHP OpenCloud
    Docs and Resources
    Getting Started Guide
    SDK Reference Manual
    Release Notes
    Community Links
    IRC: #rackspace on irc.freenode.net
    Mailing List: SDK Support
    Report Issues: Issue Tracker

    Ruby

    Official SDK
    Fog
    Docs and Resources
    Getting Started Guide
    SDK Reference Manual
    Release Notes
    Community Links
    Twitter: @fog
    IRC: #ruby-fog on irc.freenode.net
    Mailing List: ruby-fog
    Report Issues: Issue Tracker

    Command Line Interfaces

    An OpenStack Command Line Interface (CLI) is a text based client that helps you to create scripts for interacting with OpenStack clouds.

    Official CLIs

    Official CLI
    Block Storage
    Compute
    Identity Service
    Image Service
    Networking
    Object Storage
    Orchestration
    Telemetry
    Docs and Resources
    Getting Started Guide
    CLI Reference Manual
    Community Links
    Twitter: @openstack
    IRC: #openstack on irc.freenode.net
    Mailing List: Register | Archive
    Report Issues: Issue Tracker
    Support: Ask

    Application Programming Interfaces

    An Application Programming Interface (API) is blah blah blah. Use the API when the programming language you're using is not supported in an SDK. Please consider contributing that work to one of the Known SDKs.

    API

    API
    OpenStack
    Docs and Resources
    Getting Started Guide
    API Reference Manual

commit_message:
Add Ironic support to incubator.

This patch:

 - adds metadata for Ironic to testenv's.
 - adds a variable (USE_IRONIC) which controls whether to use Ironic
   or Nova-BM in baremetal clouds.
 - implements cloud bringup logic for Ironic.

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Haynes <greg@greghaynes.net>
Co-Authored-By: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ib80fa745ccd9ef54e7582d8e86fdbc49230ee616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/59/81959/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ${USE_IRONIC:-0} -eq 0 ]; then # nova baremetal DEPLOY_IMAGE_ELEMENT=${DEPLOY_IMAGE_ELEMENT:-deploy} else # Ironic DEPLOY_IMAGE_ELEMENT=${DEPLOY_IMAGE_ELEMENT:-deploy-ironic} fi

commit_message:
Fixes get_vm_storage_paths issue for Hyper-V V2 API

Add get_vm_storage_paths function to vmutilsv2.py

get_vm_storage_paths implementation on Hyper-V V2 API changed
compared to previous V1 API. In previous V1 APIs, using
Msvm_ResourceAllocationSettingData class can get storage
paths, but in V2 API, only using Msvm_StorageAllocationSettingData
class can get the storage paths.

(cherry-picked from commit 6847a0ef927929e631e9c6db2e2812528ca93151)

Closes-Bug: #1248463

Change-Id: I9821ae49d8d88345e83d7dcda22c28b87cf17e23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/83368/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _FAKE_VHD_PATH = "fake_vhd_path" _FAKE_VOLUME_DRIVE_PATH = "fake_volume_drive_path" def test_get_vm_storage_paths(self): mock_vm = self._lookup_vm() mock_vmsettings = [mock.MagicMock()] mock_vm.associators.return_value = mock_vmsettings mock_rasds = [] mock_rasd1 = mock.MagicMock() mock_rasd1.ResourceSubType = self._vmutils._IDE_DISK_RES_SUB_TYPE mock_rasd1.Connection = [self._FAKE_VHD_PATH] mock_rasd2 = mock.MagicMock() mock_rasd2.ResourceSubType = self._vmutils._PHYS_DISK_RES_SUB_TYPE mock_rasd2.HostResource = [self._FAKE_VOLUME_DRIVE_PATH] mock_rasds.append(mock_rasd1) mock_rasds.append(mock_rasd2) mock_vmsettings[0].associators.return_value = mock_rasds storage = self._vmutils.get_vm_storage_paths(self._FAKE_VM_NAME) (disk_files, volume_drives) = storage mock_vm.associators.assert_called_with( wmi_result_class='Msvm_VirtualSystemSettingData') mock_vmsettings[0].associators.assert_called_with( wmi_result_class='Msvm_ResourceAllocationSettingData') self.assertEqual([self._FAKE_VHD_PATH], disk_files) self.assertEqual([self._FAKE_VOLUME_DRIVE_PATH], volume_drives)

Added endpoint for VNC IP binding

service IP binding.

See related change: https://review.openstack.org/83441

blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I04520664c50e1f23c3affa3503f4fa74f59365df

commit_message:
Update documentation for HDS HUS cinder driver

This change propose an update in HUS documentation.
  - remove unused information
  - adds more details about the configuration of HUS volumes
  - rename driver files: as we there are new HDS drivers in the road, we
    rename the driver to avoid confusions

commit_message:
Big Switch Plugin: No REST port delete on net del

Moves the REST call for port deletion out of the
_delete_port method into the delete_port method
so it doesn't get called during a delete_network
operation. The backend controller automatically
removes ports that are a member of a network when
it's deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1295438
Change-Id: Ic09eb722f8e9bd3ce298dee90d8415cda1a1aa7a

deleted_lines: .. raw:: pdf PageBreak .. index:: CLI Deployment Workflow Understanding the CLI Deployment Workflow ========================================= To deploy OpenStack using CLI successfully you need nodes to pass through the "Prepare->Discover->Provision->Deploy" workflow. Following sections describe how to do this from the beginning to the end of the deployment. During `Prepare` stage nodes should be connected correctly to the Master node for network booting. Then turn on the nodes to boot using PXE provided by Fuel Master node. Discover -------- Nodes being booted into bootstrap mode run all the required services for the node to be managed by Fuel Master node. When booted into bootstrap phase, node contains ssh authorized keys of Master node which allows Cobbler server installed on Master node to reboot the node during provision phase. Also, bootstrap mode configures MCollective on the node and specifies ID used by Astute orchestrator to check the status of the node. Provision --------- Provisioning is done using Cobbler. Deploy ------ Deployment is done using Astute orchestrator, which parses ``nodes`` and ``attributes`` sections and recalculates parameters needed for deployment. Calculated parameters are passed to the nodes being deployed by use of astute.yaml file. Then puppet parses this file using Facter plugin and uploads the node settings into puppet. These settings are used during catalog compilation phase by puppet. Finally catalog is executed and Astute orchestrator passes to the next node in deployment sequence. .. raw:: pdf PageBreak .. index:: Deploying Using CLI Deploying OpenStack Environment Using CLI ========================================= .. contents :local: .. TODO(mihgen): Provide new information about deployment via CLI

commit_message:
Sanitize node.last_error message strings

Instead of exposing driver's exception messages in the REST API
via the node.last_error property, this patch simplifies the error
message strings while still logging the full exception for the admin.

This patch also cleans up a few related LOG messages.

Change-Id: I9a8d1f2539123f5c3d1f6bfac1d590cc75e90729
Closes-bug: 1265587

subject: Refactor LDAP API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-23 23:05:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/147fad2cef8f5c3f8e9bfacf3284909a4d3a3a78', 'message': 'Refactor LDAP API

The fake LDAP API must emulate the python-ldap API as much as possible
otherwise much of the LDAP testing is invalid. The python-ldap API
only accepts utf-8 encoded strings. However, the fake LDAP API accepts
any Python type therefore properly handling type conversion into and
out of the LDAP API is not exercised by the fake LDAP API during
testing. Currently type conversion is done inside the LdapWrapper
which calls the python-ldap API, this means unicode issues only appear
when testing with a live LDAP server.

LdapWrapper and FakeLdap logically are two different providers of the
same API, as such they should behave identically. Which LDAP API is
used at run time a configurable option.

We need a mechanism by which we can substitute an LDAP API and then
wrap the calls to that API with type conversions. Type conversion
wrapping replaces the Python types used in Keystone with the types
needed for the LDAP API, calls the LDAP API, and then type converts
the results back from LDAP to those used by Keystone.

This patch establishes an LDAP API interface (LDAPHandler), modifies
fake LDAP to support it, replaces LdapWrapper with the interface
(invoking python-ldap) and adds another LDAPHandler instance which
will be the common location for type conversions prior to calling the
configured LDAP interface. See the LDAPHandler class definition for
details).

This patch is exclusively a refactoring patch anticipating a
subsequent patch to properly handle unicode values. There is no
significant change in functionality with this patch, it is just
refactoring to more cleanly seperate API boundaries. A few tests which
exercised unicode were disabled in this patch because they will not
work until the next patch which adds back in correct unicode
handling. The idea here is to separate out the refactoring needed to
support unicode from the actual unicode changes, this should make
reviewing easier.

Change-Id: I7db24040689245a616332b08744f40ab8381579d
